metadata.title: CVE-2023-32207 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A missing delay in popup notifications could have made it possible for anattacker to trick a user into granting permissions. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 113, Firefox ESR < 102.11, and Thunderbird < 102.11.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
